Bad Feeling Spots- clarification?
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 3 Archive (PS2): Miscellaneous Q&A (Post New Questions Here): Bad Feeling Spots- clarification?
By Lady Neptune on Tuesday, December 11, 2007 - 08:26 pm:

Just a little confused, the Map of Goat section has a different "Bad Feeling" spot than Lisa's post on "Get those Techs!"... which has listed
"Goat:
1. The big Octopus head
2. The left side of the giant seashell.
3. The right side of the long shell. "
But the map has it listed in the back, near the rock with the seaweed (which is a Noisy Hall) instead of on the right side of the long seashell.
Which one is correct?

Also the Brillia map and the locations listed on Lisa's page conflict. Hers says
"3. The top tree next to the spot that let's you jump"
But the map shows it as an empty spot on the right along the way to the top of the cliff instead.

I just want a little clarification, because some of the raising guides(DMM which I'm trying now) say to focus on the Noisy Halls, and then do the Bad Feeling spots, but I'm not sure which spots to check and often run out of Ran Ran...

By Lady Neptune on Tuesday, December 11, 2007 - 08:28 pm:

The maps from the Locales section btw.

By Monster Fenrick on Wednesday, December 12, 2007 - 06:56 am:

It's been a while, but I was comparing the maps on Legendcup vs the Locale map here and they do seem to differ, regarding Goat. The pink triange that is on the lower right of the screen... on LCs map has along the right side of the long shell. I'm not sure which is correct.

If I recall, the Bad Feeling spots are not always bad feeling spots, they could be other things, but those spots are the only places "bad Feelings" will happen.

for Brilla, read up under: "Locales: Brillia (Arctic): Brillia Topography" and read Torey's comments about it. maybe that will help you navigate the zone more easily.

By Lady Neptune on Thursday, December 13, 2007 - 11:11 pm:

From the overview map in Brillia the top tree by the spot you can jump from is barely visible (it should be right across from the glowing snowflake tree but since it isn't glowing it isn't as noticible but there's still a visible yellow dot over it in the Locales map). The spot marked with a pink triangle is actually very close to the ramp and isn't a tree or by a tree.
But I guess that could mean that it isn't the top tree that's the right spot since your other map agrees?
And yeah, but iunno... I know that they aren't always Bad feeling spots. It's not just the raising guide, it's also that I've never found a single aqua or aurora orb before, so I'm trying to now...
